Detailed Description

A pair of (host, port).

The host is not a hostname, but a resolved (ip) address.

It is important that the host+port is a unambiguous and unique address within a network using an implemenation of sevent::socket, since this is the key used to check for existing connections.

The host is a string to make it possible to use any kind of address. The asio implementation uses this for both ipv4 (dot notation) and ipv6 (hex encoding).
